funny at all

Game is a fun idea, and is fun in practice.  The problem is, trying to play the game as a survivor.  There are issues where 4 survivors are ready, but only 3 will make it into the game (happens multiple times per play period).  Also, the issue arises to where you can't even join a game.  Once this happens I have to completely restart my PC in order to join a game as a survivor.  Playing as the killer is awesome, and haven't run into any technical issues doing so, as it seems the killer is the person who creates the lobby, so haven't seen any issues so far with that. Personally, I can't recommend the game as it is.  Maybe after some fixes by the devs, but now, no.

我最近重新开始玩了，玩了几天，然后发现了2次比较严重影响游戏体验的bug，一个是翻箱子后获取物品的bug，翻了地下室箱子出了一个紫手电然后看着有点怪异因为是反向的我以为只是模型错误没管，然后电机开完队友被抓我去救了后溜鬼翻了一个板子鬼打算踩我就直接拿起手电照。。。这个时候诡异的事情发生了。。。手电的光尼玛竟然是反的。。。我就这样浪费了鬼踩板子的那么一丢丢逃跑时间被一刀后献祭了。。。我可去你的吧！！！
第二次是刚刚进了一个绿网房间然后进入游戏，屠夫是杨某我和队友被刷在地下室边上我打算一起摸电机然后发现除了视角和能蹲下以外什么都做不了。。。我自带的工具箱可是带了2个修电机的配件啊！而且还带了绿的目标加成！只能被砍翻无法抵抗队友来救我上去的路上还被砍了，我开设定换键位换成了小键盘的上下左右然并卵插上xbox手柄也没用，队友全灭我被献祭后就卡在钩子画面了，无法切换视角无法结束游戏拔线也不行只能开任务管理器强关真是游戏体验贼差

This is a fun game with good mechanics, but the execution needs a major overhaul. There is no lobby or match making system; a peer-to-peer setup so YOUR game depends on your opponent; no way to see ping; and no servers. It's still a good game but I'd highly recommend to buy this game only during a sale - Friday the 13th (2017) is going to crush this game if these developers don't get their act together and listen to all the complaints they're getting over this.

This game feels like a great idea that will someday become a genre-defining game...
Made by somebody else.

Let me explain. This game has a great core idea and really delivers on it. It is thrilling to play as either the killer or the hunted survivors as you wander the dark, atmospheric maps. This game is much more fun to play than watch; I saw a few Let's Plays of it and decided it wasn't for me. However, when you are actually in the game and know that you are being hunted by a real human opponent and not an AI, it adds a terrifying sense of urgency to your action and fearful caution when you hear the monster coming your way.

That is the good of this game; it really conveys that sense that you are in a horror movie, forced to run from an enemy too deadly to confront head-on.

However, the game has too many problems baked into its foundation to last long after the initial rush of running from dangerous enemies controlled by a human player. The first problem is the very low skill ceiling. Once you play the game for 6-8 hours, you'll be good enough to hit 95% of the "skill checks" that the survivors must hit. After that, the game becomes very repetitive and entirely based on whether your killer is competent enough to hunt you down and make it fun or breeze by.

Another problem is the terrible balancing for survivors once one of you is caught. The top priority for the killer is wiping out the survivors so that they cannot escape the level -- they have to hit you twice and then carry your body to a hook where you bleed out on a timer. Though there is a mechanic where other survivors can save people from these hooks, in practice 90% of the humans playing the killer will camp the bleeding out survivor. Even if you rush them with all the standing survivors, one of you will certainly be down by the end of the rescue and the problem starts all over again. This makes the hook rescue mechanic worthless unless you have a killer who refuses to camp out of good sportsmanship.

There is a level up system where you advance survivors (and killers) the more you play with them. Unfortunately the randomly generated rewards seem arbitrary and useless, usually leaving you with more addons for items than items to add them to.

Finally, as others have said, the stability of the multiplayer is atrocious. About 1 out of every 4 times you go to join a lobby, you're left with a game-freezing loading screen bug. Plus, when lobbies actually do connect, usually a survivor or two will time out for one reason or another, leaving the remaining survivors with a very reduced cahnce of winning.

All in all, this is a good concept that I'm sure someone else will see the merit of and implement it much better from the ground up.

I have played this game for a long time, and Ive been with it since the game came out. I have seen every bad thing that has happened with this game and plain and simple heres the truth, the game can be fun, but there are two major things holding it back.

Thing 1: The Community
This game has the worst community out of any game I have ever played and it not only allows for those people to be toxic, it also actively promotes it. This community will not hesitate to spam your profile over the smallest thing, and that goes for both killer and survivors. 

Thing 2: The Developers
The devs of this game are by far the most incompetent people I have ever seen, they listen to the worst parts of the community and make terrible descions and introduce game breaking mechanics and tell people to play other games if they dont like the changes. The most recent example of this being the matchmaking ban system, that will ban you even if your game crashes and increases each time you disconnect. The developers see there game as being seperated in mechanics, however many of them conflict with each other, leading to people being unable to even play the game for over a week if they crash from how poorly optimized this game is at times. The list of dev fuckups is so long that there are entire reddits dedicated to how they break the game or how one sided they are in it. They dont listen, plain and simple.

Aswell i found that games are not very balance. As exemple, you can play a match with rank 1 player when you are rank 20 (highest vs lowest), or you can play vs players that can use 4 perks at a time when you only have one (have to be level 25 to be able to have 4 perks at a time).

I recommand this game on sale, you always want to play another game, but still the community sucks hard.

Oh boy the thrill! Hunt or be hunted in this game. Either way, you are going to have fun and sometimes be frustrated because of the early lack of utility/perks. (A hint to that later)

I am really enjoying playing the game and haven't encountered any bug whatsoever til now, so I really ask myself which bugs users are talking about. I only experienced some people disconnecting because of connectivity issues but nothing more.

[b]The bloodweb:[/b] The bloodweb is a procedurally generated skilltree that allows you to spend your hard-earned bloodpoints (LITTLE HINT: Use killers to farm points in the beginning and use them on survivors) to buy items, perks, offerings and more.

[b]As a killer:[/b] You have your very own skill and you are walking around the map trying to find and kill the survivors. After landing a hit on one of them you need to wait a few seconds for a post-hit animation that slows you down and prevents you from hitting repeatedly. You have to watch out for people using wooden planks to stun you and keep an eye on the hook you just hooked a wounded survivor on in case he gets freed. If a survivor is hooked long enough he "dies" and gets sacrificed. Mindgames when chasing one of them are welcome (fake a left turn and then go right).

[b]As a survivor:[/b] Teamplay and stealth are key to victory. Each survivor has an increased chance to find perks fitting them in their bloodweb. (Meg will find more helping her escape, run faster or hide easier etc.) You can heal your teammates, repair generators (if you repair enough of them you can open the gates and escape), sabotate hooks, search crates etc. Eevery once in a while While you are doing these things you can hear a sound that warns you of an impending skill check. Skill checks mean you have to hit space at the right time or you will make noise alerting the killer. Items, with their corresponding add-ons help you in this task or in survival.
